name: Thalassa
body:
**!!CAVEAT!!**-_**this is a work in progress!**_
### What exactly is this?
Thalassa is a lightweight implementation of the [WAMP V2 protocol](http://wamp.ws/), written in php.

### !What is
Thalassa is not a web-socket server.Although it is built upon web-sockets and fully implements the web-socket protocol, specifically [RFC6455](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6455).Support for older protocols may be added.
Thalassa will only work for clients implementing WAMP as a websocket sub-protocol, and hence is better defined as a WAMP
server, as opposed to a _WAMP-capable_ websocket server.

### Features
Thalassa features an event-driven IO using [libevent](http://www.php.net/manual/en/book.libevent.php), and implements the role of a router and a dealer.

### Requirements
A working installation of the [libevent library](http://libevent.org/) and [necessary extensions](http://pecl.php.net/package/libevent).
 
### Installing
Composer:
`"require": {`
	    `"nsautomaton/thalassa": "dev-master"`
           `}`

***
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
